title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Diego H.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: outlines propose change geobounds. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/geobounds", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Please note geobounds project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: geobounds package provides R-friendly interface access work geoBoundaries dataset (open-license global database administrative boundary polygons). Using package, can: Programmatically retrieve administrative boundary geometries (e.g., country → region → district) geoBoundaries Use tidyverse / sf workflows R map, analyse join boundaries data Work open-data context (geoBoundaries uses CC -4.0 / open licences) short: work geospatial boundaries R (shape files, polygons, join data), package simplifies process.

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: can install developing version geobounds : Alternatively, can install geobounds using r-universe:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("dieghernan/geobounds") # Install geobounds in R: install.packages("geobounds",   repos = c(     "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) )

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: Note: simple illustration. See package vignettes full details parameters, filters, caching, advanced usage.
code: library(geobounds)  spain_bounds <- get_geobn("ESP") spain_adm1 <- get_geobn("ESP", boundary_type = "ADM1")  library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.13.1, GDAL 3.11.0, PROJ 9.6.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  gal <- spain_adm1 %>%   filter(shapeName == "Galicia")  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(spain_bounds) +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = gal, fill = "lightblue")

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: Visit pkgdown site full documentation: https://dieghernan.github.io/geobounds/ Explore geoBoundaries homepage: https://www.geoboundaries.org/ Read original paper describing geoBoundaries dataset (Runfola 2020).

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: package released CC -4.0 license. See LICENSE.md file full details. Note boundary data accessed (via geoBoundaries) also uses open licences; please check specific dataset metadata licensing details.

title: Download Map Data from GeoBoundaries
text: Many thanks geoBoundaries￼ team William & Mary geoLab creating maintaining dataset. ￼ Thanks R package community contributors package’s development. use geobounds (underlying geoBoundaries data) research project, citation acknowledgement greatly appreciated.

what: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: Use function caution. function clear cached data configuration, specifically: Deletes geobounds config directory (rappdirs::user_config_dir("geobounds", "R")). Deletes cache_dir directory. Deletes values stored Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") options(mapSpain_cache_dir).

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
code: geobn_clear_cache(config = FALSE, cached_data = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: config Logical. TRUE, delete configuration folder geobounds. cached_data Logical. TRUE, delete cache_dir content. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: Invisible. function called side effects.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: overkill function intended reset status never installed /used geobounds.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
code: # Don't run this! It would modify your current state if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ geobn_clear_cache(verbose = TRUE) } # }  Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") #> [1] ""

what: Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir
title: Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir
text: Helper function detect current cache folder. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir
Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir
text: x Ignored.

title: Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir
text: character path cache_dir.

title: Detect cache dir for geobounds — geobn_detect_cache_dir

what: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: function store cache_dir path local machine load future sessions. Type Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") find cached path. Alternatively, can store cache_dir manually following options: Run Sys.setenv(GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "cache_dir"). need run command session (Similar install = FALSE). Write line .Renviron file: GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "value_for_cache_dir" (behavior install = TRUE). store cache_dir permanently.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
code: geobn_set_cache_dir(   cache_dir,   overwrite = FALSE,   install = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). overwrite Logical. set TRUE, overwrite existing GEOBN_CACHE_DIR already local machine. install Logical. TRUE, install key local machine use future sessions.  Defaults FALSE. cache_dir FALSE parameter set FALSE automatically. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: (invisible) character path cache_dir.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
code: # Don't run this! It would modify your current state if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ geobn_set_cache_dir(verbose = TRUE) } # }  Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp4mwtt5/geobounds"

what: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'GeoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
title: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'GeoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
text: Tools download data 'geoBoundaries' https://www.geoboundaries.org/. Several administration levels available. See Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'GeoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: Return spatial object using sf.

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
code: get_geobn(   country,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   boundary_type = c("ADM0", "ADM1", "ADM2", "ADM3", "ADM4", "ALL"),   simplified = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   update_cache = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names vector ISO3 country codes. Mixed types (c("Italy","ES","FRA")) work. See also countrycode::countrycode(). release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"`. Source spatial data. See Details. boundary_type Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("ADM0" country boundary, "ADM1" first level sub national boundaries, "ADM2" second level . simplified Logical. Return simplified boundary . metadata result metadata boundary? See Details. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source .geojson file. cache_dir path cache directory. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: metadata = FALSE: sf object, otherwise tibble.

shapeGroup shapeType                  geometry #>  * <chr>         <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                <GEOMETRY [°]> #>  1 Manmunai Sou… ""       854035… LKA        ADM3      POLYGON
